Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_GEN_RESPONSE
Define.Description: The tag containing the main general response from the Phoromatic Server or the current task to engage in.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_TRIGGER
Define.Description: The Trigger is an ID such as the date of the test run (if time based) or the event triggered that's causing the test run (i.e. the revision/commit number).

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SET_CONTEXT_PRE_INSTALL
Define.Description: The location of a locally stored script that should be executed pre-installation of any Phoromatic-called test installations to set the context of the system or address any other setup needs.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SET_CONTEXT_PRE_RUN
Define.Description: The location of a locally stored script that should be executed prior to running any Phoromatic-called tests to set the context of the system or address any other setup needs.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_ID
Define.Description: The Phoromatic schedule ID

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SYS_NAME
Define.Description: The test system's name given by the Phoromatic Server.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_UPLOAD_TO_GLOBAL
Define.Description: A string bool whether to upload the test results to OpenBenchmarking.org upon completion.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_UPLOAD_TEST_LOGS
Define.Description: A string bool whether to upload the test logs to the Phoromatic Server.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_UPLOAD_SYSTEM_LOGS
Define.Description: A string bool whether to upload the system logs to the Phoromatic Server.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_ARCHIVE_RESULTS_LOCALLY
Define.Description: A string bool whether to keep/archive the results/logs locally after test completion or whether they should just be deleted.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RUN_INSTALL_COMMAND
Define.Description: A string bool whether to run the install command prior to executing the test suite to either install missing tests or update already installed tests if needed.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SERVER_BUILD
Define.Description: The build version of the Phoromatic Server currently connected to.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SCHEDULE_TEST_TITLE
Define.Description: A string of the title of the current test schedule.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SCHEDULE_TEST_DESCRIPTION
Define.Description: A string of the description of the current test schedule.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SCHEDULE_TEST_ACTIVE_ON
Define.Description: When sharing the test schedules with the Phoromatic client for information purposes, this is a string showing the days in which the given test schedule is active. Each day is one character beginning on Sunday and goes through Saturday with either a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the schedule is active on that day of the week.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_SCHEDULE_TEST_START
Define.Description: For test schedules that function on a timed basis, this is the Phoromatic Server time at which to run the test.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_IDLE
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, the client should idle.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_EXIT
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, the client should exit the Phoronix Test Suite.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_RUN_TEST
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, the client should prepare to run the specified suite.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_SERVER_MAINTENANCE
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, the Phoromatic Server is currently undergoing server maintenance and thus the client should wait and then try to communicate again.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_ERROR
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, an error occurred in the previous request.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_TRUE
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, this is the default response that the previous request was processed appropriately.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_SETTING_DISABLED
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, the requested setting is currently disabled on the Phoromatic Server.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_SHUTDOWN
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, the Phoromatic Server should attempt to shutdown the system.

Define.Name: M_PHOROMATIC_RESPONSE_REBOOT
Define.Description: When the Phoromatic Server transmits this response, the Phoromatic Server should attempt to reboot the system.
